Keywords: Armor , Avengers , Fantastic Four , Latveria , Mystical , Scientist
Real Name: Victor Von Doom
Special Powers
TARGETING: Hindering, Characters
STARTING PLOT POINTS: 1
KO EFFECT: When Infamous Iron Man is KO'd, opposing characters can use Outwit until the end of your next turn.
(+1) SO MUCH POTENTIAL, WASTED: FREE: Outwit until your next turn. When he uses it, he may instead target any number of characters he has hit this turn and may choose different powers for each.
(-1) I WILL BE IRON MAN: FREE: Make an attack with 4 Targets. Hit characters are dealt a maximum of 1 damage.
(-2) I LEAVE YOU TO CONSIDER THE SUBTEXT OF OUR INTERACTION: FREE: Halve speed, Phasing/Teleport as FREE. After resolutions, Infamous Iron Man can use Regeneration as FREE.
(-5) A SPELL CYCLE TO CHEAT DEMONS AND DEVILS: FREE: Turn Infamous Iron Man to click #1. This game, Infamous Iron Man has Cosmic Energy team ability, can't be healed, may activate each of his other Plot Point abilities once per turn for +0 PP, and when Infamous Iron Man is KO'd you lose the game.

Alchemical fire on this guy is so nasty put it on pen damage and activate a plot point to get 4 targets EE now doing pen is brutal I made a theme team with him an the new mad Jim jaspers prime it looks really nice on paper won’t be able to try it out for a few months though
January 28, 2022
BLsquared
Yeah, I came across this realization as well. So, for a 300pt modern event, I made him a Herald of Galactus on a Scientist theme team, which included prime Marvell equipped with the Alchemical Fire (permanently set to the -2 attack option lol), Sunspot at 50pts to help against damage (equipped with the Carnage Symbiote if he had time to grab it), and a blue AIM guy equipped with the Reality Gem. I also had to focus his plot points on the healing, although the free attack became useful when I could get him on PenPsy. I was able to absolutely destroy a Blackheart team though, which was more than I expected; this specific combo was extremely useful (particularly the EE).
January 28, 2022
muel0017
[QUOTE=BLsquared;12173695]Another fun thing about this guy is, if you don't like the attack power he has showing, you can use his Outwit plot ability and just not attack to "push" him a click.[/QUOTE] This is exactly what I did with him the other night when using him. I was only able to get him to +3 plot points before I had to -2 to phase away and heal. His big weakness is Outwit. Mystics TA helps a bit with deterring him from being attacked but ultimately if he gets run up on and outwitted (defense) that -2 Plot ability comes in handy.

You know thats a really good suggestion from BLsquared. With title characters if you plot and dont attack you take a click so you can easily get to his second pen blast click. Depending on what you are facing that is definitely a great option.

December 17, 2021
BLsquared
This guy has been an unclixed want of mine for a while. He looks like a lot of fun, and is definitely more of a "team player" version of Doom than he usually get. Which is actually pretty cool! I'm just not sure if I want to put him with Avengers or Scientists lol, and what equipment would complement him best. With Scientist, Josiah X and the new Sunspot at 50 seem like easy choices, maybe SVAC Superior Spider Man as a secondary attacker. I'll have to see how he plays in practice.
December 8, 2021
Goop
I wish he had a shared penblast/ee like some other figs in this set do. Having EE top click for 100pts isn't great. Still though he's a pretty interesting piece that can be tough for your opponents to deal with. I dont like that his outwit has to happen after his attack. I think just using his +1 -1 every other turn is worth his value though. I like you can still -1 when you are pushed out. Pulling off that -5 late game when its a close match can put you over the top. Its a tough call between him and Doom 2099 which is a better title piece.
